ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
What is your overall rating of the primary instructor?
The primary instructor's sensitivity to students and ability to provide students with adequate feedback was:

narratives.question_text: Indicate the total number of hours per week (outside the classroom) you spent on this course:
Looking back on this course, what is your overall assessment of the course:  What are its strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might it be improved?
comments: Helpful topics - particularly enjoyed the mentorship session. The grant review session was also extremely helpful.
a necessary class. not very exciting but that's the nature of ethics
The course helps me know the dos and don'ts in academic study. Somewhat helpful.
Strength: short lectures, no work, open discussions Weakness: not helpful for masters students
Strength: - it's definitely a useful course - everyone should have training in research ethics
Maybe can combine some sections. It may be better to have 4 two-hour lessons instead of 8 one-hour lessons

narratives.question_text: Please evaluate the instructor of this course. What are the instructor's strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might his or her teaching be improved?
comments: Instructor: Christian Tschudi  kind, funny, approachable. great professor
Instructor: Christian Tschudi  Strength: very positive, funny, understanding, concise lecturer Weakness: comic sans on lectures!
Instructor: Christian Tschudi  Strength: - Dr. Tshcudi is very friendly and approachable - He made the sessions interesting and relevant

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize this course for a fellow student? Would you recommend it to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Easy class with no work, straight to the point, should take if doing research
